channel.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
channel.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

image.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
image.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

item.title: Biden and Xi hold first discussions since November, talk Taiwan and tech
item.description: Call comes ahead of flurry of diplomatic engagement, with both US and China maintaining they want to reduce friction.

item.title: Staying Behind in Gaza
item.description: "This is our land. This is our home."

item.title: Gaza infrastructure damages estimated at $18.5bn in UN-World Bank report
item.description: The initial assessment is likely to be an underestimate of the real damages, losses and needs in Gaza.

item.title: Four hundred years on, Mexico’s oldest Black community struggles to survive
item.description: Climate change, poverty threaten to wash away the coastal community founded by fugitive slaves.

item.title: Why is Israel targeting Al Jazeera?
item.description: PM Benjamin Netanyahu says network will no longer broadcast from Israel because it threatens national security.

item.title: Netanyahu says Israeli forces killed World Central Kitchen workers in Gaza
item.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu confirms Israel launched attack that killed seven charity workers in Gaza.

item.title: Al Jazeera Sanad probe: Israeli forces deliberately hit WCK convoy
item.description: Israeli army deliberately targeted World Central Kitchen convoy with three consecutive attacks, Al Jazeera concludes.

item.title: Cyprus concerned over spike in arrivals of Syrian refugees from Lebanon
item.description: Arrivals of Syrian asylum seekers have surged, with more than 350 such arrivals recorded in two days.

item.title: Why are thousands protesting against Netanyahu’s government in Israel?
item.description: Israeli citizens have taken to the streets in anti-government protests, calling for ceasefire and return of captives.

item.title: Ukrainian drone strikes Tatarstan, deep inside Russian territory
item.description: A Ukrainian drone struck Russia’s Tatarstan, injuring around a dozen people and creating a fireball.

item.title: Biden is still the best US president Israel could wish for
item.description: The meaningless ceasefire resolution his administration allowed the UN Security Council to pass should not fool anyone.

item.title: Photos: Senegal’s youngest president, Bassirou Diomaye Faye, sworn in
item.description: Commonly known as Diomaye, or 'the honourable one' in the local Serer language, Faye won election with 54% of the vote.

item.title: Fire at nightclub in Turkey’s Istanbul kills at least 29 people
item.description: Blaze breaks out during renovation work, according to the Istanbul governor.

item.title: Israel bombs World Central Kitchen convoy killing foreign aid workers
item.description: Seven aid workers with the charity World Central Kitchen were killed in an Israeli strike.

item.title: Iran’s Khamenei promises ‘Israel will be punished’ for Syria strike
item.description: The attack and rhetoric raise concern that Israel's war in Gaza threatens to escalate major conflict across the region.

item.title: The surge in Islamophobia on Biden’s watch is unprecedented
item.description: We are seeing levels of Islamophobia in the US that surpass the ones triggered by Trump’s Muslim ban.

item.title: Who was Mohammad Reza Zahedi, an Iranian general killed by Israel in Syria?
item.description: Zahedi was the highest ranking commander to be killed since Major General Qassem Soleimani died in 2020 US drone strike.

item.title: How will Gen Z react to the TikTok ban in the US?
item.description: The future of those who've turned the platform into an arena for change hangs in the balance in the US.

item.title: From prisoner to president in 20 days, Senegal’s Diomaye Faye takes office
item.description: As the 44-year-old is sworn in after a crucial election, we chart the road to victory for Africa’s youngest leader.

item.title: Iran vows to retaliate after strike on consulate in Damascus
item.description: Iranian protesters are calling for revenge against Israel after a missile strike destroyed Iran’s consulate in Syria.

item.title: ‘I’ve lost everything’: Palestine footballer Balah on Israel’s war on Gaza
item.description: Gaza-born forward Mohammed Balah tells Al Jazeera how the war has brought his promising football career to a halt.

item.title: What is World Central Kitchen, whose team was attacked by Israel in Gaza?
item.description: The NGO has provided food aid in some of the world's biggest disasters and conflicts, from Haiti to Ukraine.

item.title: Watching the watchdogs: Israel’s attacks on journalists are backfiring
item.description: Israel is killing Palestinian journalists, banning foreign media from reporting on Gaza – and losing credibility.

item.title: Russia says explosives sent from Ukraine via EU countries seized
item.description: Authorities say they have seized cargo comprising of home-made explosives as Ukrainian drones hit deep inside Russia.

item.title: School shooting in Finland kills one, injures two as child opens fire
item.description: The 12-year-old shooter was arrested following the incident in a Helsinki suburb.
